summary: The National Nuclear Security Administration uses 3 fusion facilities to conduct experiments to help maintain and modernize the nuclear weapons stockpile. In 2023, the agency submitted a required plan to Congress for repairing and upgrading these facilities. The 10-year plan includes information on related activities, costs, and timelines. The plan also includes information for proposed near-term activities, which would cost about $492 million over 6-8...
title: National Nuclear Security Administration: Improvements Needed for Managing Recapitalization of Fusion Facilities
